DataElement.preferredName: Union for International Cancer Control TNM Staging System Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the pathological stage of the distant metastasis using the Union for International Cancer Control staging system as a basis for evaluation of the disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Union for International Cancer Control Staging System Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The International Union Against Cancer (UICC) is the only global cancer organisation with members and activities covering all aspects of cancer control. Founded in 1933, UICC is an independent, international, non-governmental association of 291 member cancer fighting organizations in 87 countries. Located in Geneva, Switzerland._A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.:A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a specific cancer, following the rules of the TNM classification system as they pertain to staging of distant metastases.

ObjectClass.preferredName: International Union Against Cancer TNM Staging System
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The International Union Against Cancer (UICC) is the only global cancer organisation with members and activities covering all aspects of cancer control. Founded in 1933, UICC is an independent, international, non-governmental association of 291 member cancer fighting organizations in 87 countries. Located in Geneva, Switzerland._A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.

Concepts.definition: A global cancer organisation comprising over 1200 organisations in 172 countries with activities covering all aspects of cancer control. It was founded in 1933 as the International Union Against Cancer. The organisation is dedicated to taking the lead in convening, capacity building and advocacy initiatives that unite and support the cancer community to reduce the global cancer burden, promote greater equity, and to ensure cancer control continues to be a priority in the world health and development agenda.

A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a specific cancer, following the rules of the TNM classification system as they pertain to staging of distant metastases.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a specific cancer, following the rules of the TNM classification system as they pertain to evaluating distant metastases.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: UICC Based:Staging Criteria Based on Union for International Cancer Control

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a specific cancer, following the rules of the TNM classification system as they pertain to staging of distant metastases._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A distant metastasis TNM finding indicating that there is no evidence of distant metastasis.

Concepts.definition: A distant metastasis TNM finding indicating that there is no evidence of distant metastasis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical and/or pathologic distant metastasis TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites.

Concepts.definition: A clinical and/or pathologic distant metastasis TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites.  The definition of M1a TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for colorectal cancer it refers to metastasis confined to one organ or site (e.g., liver, lung, ovary, nonregional node); for prostate cancer it refers to metastasis to non-regional lymph node(s); for bone cancer it refers to metastasis to the lung.

Concepts.definition: A TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites.  The definition of M1a TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for colorectal cancer it refers to metastasis confined to one organ or site (e.g., liver, lung, ovary, nonregional node); for prostate cancer it refers to metastasis to non-regional lymph node(s); for bone cancer it refers to metastasis to the lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites.  The definition of M1b TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for colorectal cancer it refers to metastases in more than one organ/site or the peritoneum; for prostate cancer it refers to metastasis to bone(s); for bone cancer it refers to metastasis to distant sites other than lung.

Concepts.definition: A TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites.  The definition of M1b TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for colorectal cancer it refers to metastases in more than one organ/site or the peritoneum; for prostate cancer it refers to metastasis to bone(s); for bone cancer it refers to metastasis to distant sites other than lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites.  The definition of M1c TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for prostate cancer it refers to metastasis to anatomic site(s) other than bone, with or without bone disease; for retinoblastoma it refers to central nervous system metastasis; for melanoma of the uvea it refers to distant metastasis, with the largest diameter of the largest metastasis measuring 8.0 cm or more.

Concepts.definition: A TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites.  The definition of M1c TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for prostate cancer it refers to metastasis to anatomic site(s) other than bone, with or without bone disease; for retinoblastoma it refers to central nervous system metastasis; for melanoma of the uvea it refers to distant metastasis, with the largest diameter of the largest metastasis measuring 8.0 cm or more.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A distant metastasis TNM finding indicating that the status of distant metastasis cannot be assessed.

Concepts.definition: A distant metastasis TNM finding indicating that the status of distant metastasis cannot be assessed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A distant metastasis TNM finding indicating that there is no evidence of distant metastasis clinically or by radiologic studies, but there are small numbers of cells detected by special studies in the blood and bone marrow, or there is tiny metastasis (no larger than 0.2 mm) detected in nonregional lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: A distant metastasis TNM finding indicating that there is no evidence of distant metastasis clinically or by radiologic studies, but there are small numbers of cells detected by special studies in the blood and bone marrow, or there is tiny metastasis (no larger than 0.2 mm) detected in nonregional lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites. The definition of M1d TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer to which it refers: for example, for cutaneous melanoma it indicates distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease. LDH level not recorded or unspecified.

Concepts.definition: A TNM finding indicating the spread of cancer to distant anatomic sites. The definition of M1d TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer to which it refers: for example, for cutaneous melanoma it indicates distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease. LDH level not recorded or unspecified.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A stage term that refers to a central nervous system embryonal malignant tumor (e.g., atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor, medulloblastoma, pineoblastoma) in which gross nodular tumor seeding is detected in the cerebellar/cerebral subarachnoid space or in the third or lateral ventricles.

Concepts.definition: A stage term that refers to central nervous system embryonal tumor or ependymoma in which visible metastasis is present in the brain.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a specific cancer, following the rules of the TNM classification system as they pertain to staging of distant metastases._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of a specific cancer, following the rules of the TNM classification system as they pertain to evaluating distant metastases.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
